alert.note: Alert for Calloway; Carlisle; Graves; Hickman; Marshall; McCracken (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 4:12PM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Calloway, southwestern Marshall, southeastern Carlisle, northeastern Hickman, south central McCracken and Graves Counties through 400 PM CDT... At 312 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles south of Reidland to near Mayfield to near Fulgham. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Mayfield around 315 PM CDT. Sedalia around 325 PM CDT. Benton around 330 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Murray and Lynnville. This includes Interstate 69 in Kentucky between Mile Markers 5 and 42. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Calloway; Carlisle; Graves; Hickman; Marshall; McCracken
